title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement b-cubedsupport@meisebotanicgarden.. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to b3gbi
text: outlines propose change b3gbi. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to b3gbi
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to b3gbi
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to b3gbi
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("shawndove/b3gbi", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to b3gbi
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to b3gbi
text: Please note b3gbi project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Dove S (2024). b3gbi: General Biodiversity Indicators Biodiversity Data Cubes. R package version 0.1.0, https://shawndove.github.io/b3gbi/, https://github.com/ShawnDove/b3gbi.
code: @Manual{,   title = {b3gbi: General Biodiversity Indicators for Biodiversity Data Cubes},   author = {Shawn Dove},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0, https://shawndove.github.io/b3gbi/},   url = {https://github.com/ShawnDove/b3gbi}, }

what: General Biodiversity Indicators for Biodiversity Data Cubes
title: General Biodiversity Indicators for Biodiversity Data Cubes
text: Analyze biodiversity trends spatial patterns GBIF data cubes, using flexible indicators like richness, evenness, .

title: General Biodiversity Indicators for Biodiversity Data Cubes
text: Biodiversity researchers need robust standardized tools analyze vast amounts data available platforms like GBIF. b3gbi package leverages power data cubes streamline biodiversity assessments. helps researchers gain insights : Changes Time: biodiversity metrics shift throughout years. Spatial Variations: Differences biodiversity across regions, identifying hotspots areas concern. Impact Factors: different environmental variables human activities might affect biodiversity patterns.

title: General Biodiversity Indicators for Biodiversity Data Cubes
text: b3gbi empowers biodiversity analysis : Standardized Workflows: Simplify process calculating common biodiversity indicators GBIF data cubes. Flexibility: Calculate richness, evenness, rarity, taxonomic distinctness, Shannon-Hill diversity, Simpson-Hill diversity, . Analysis Options: Explore temporal trends create spatial maps. Visualization Tools: Generate publication-ready plots biodiversity metrics.

title: General Biodiversity Indicators for Biodiversity Data Cubes
text: can install development version b3gbi GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") # devtools::install_github("shawndove/b3gbi")

title: General Biodiversity Indicators for Biodiversity Data Cubes
text: basic example shows calculate plot map species richness data cube containing GBIF occurrence data amphibians Europe:
code: # Load necessary libraries library(b3gbi) library(data.table) library(ggplot2)  # Load GBIF data cube cube_name <- "inst/extdata/europe_amphibians_cube.csv"  # Load taxonomic info for cube tax_info <- "inst/extdata/europe_amphibians_info.csv"  # Prepare cube amphib_data <- process_cube(cube_name, tax_info)  # Calculate diversity metric map_obs_rich_amphib <- calculate_indicator(amphib_data, type = "obs_rich")  # Plot diversity metric plot(map_obs_rich_amphib, title = "Observed Species Richness: Amphibians in Europe")

what: b3gbi: General Biodiversity Indicators for Biodiversity Data Cubes — b3gbi-package
title: b3gbi: General Biodiversity Indicators for Biodiversity Data Cubes — b3gbi-package
text: Calculate general biodiversity indicators GBIF data cubes. Includes many common indicators species richness evenness, can calculated time (trends) space (maps).

title: b3gbi: General Biodiversity Indicators for Biodiversity Data Cubes — b3gbi-package
text: Maintainer: Shawn Dove Shawn.Dove@allzool.bio.uni-giessen.de (ORCID)

what: Calculate a Biodiversity Indicator Map — calc_map.obs_richness
title: Calculate a Biodiversity Indicator Map — calc_map.obs_richness
text: generic function calculating spatial biodiversity indicator maps. Specific implementations different indicator types mapping approaches provided using S3 methods.

title: Calculate a Biodiversity Indicator Map — calc_map.obs_richness
code: # S3 method for obs_richness calc_map(x, ...)  # S3 method for total_occ calc_map(x, ...)  # S3 method for newness calc_map(x, newness_min_year = NULL, ...)  # S3 method for occ_density calc_map(x, ...)  # S3 method for williams_evenness calc_map(x, ...)  # S3 method for pielou_evenness calc_map(x, ...)  # S3 method for ab_rarity calc_map(x, ...)  # S3 method for area_rarity calc_map(x, ...)  calc_map(x)

title: Calculate a Biodiversity Indicator Map — calc_map.obs_richness
text: x object containing geospatial data information required map calculation. ... Additional arguments (potentially used specific methods).

title: Calculate a Biodiversity Indicator Map — calc_map.obs_richness
text: object representing calculated biodiversity indicator map. format output depend specific S3 method used.

what: Calculate a Biodiversity Indicator Time Series — calc_ts.obs_richness
title: Calculate a Biodiversity Indicator Time Series — calc_ts.obs_richness
text: generic function calculating biodiversity indicator time series data. Specific implementations different indicator types calculation methods provided using S3 methods.

title: Calculate a Biodiversity Indicator Time Series — calc_ts.obs_richness
code: # S3 method for obs_richness calc_ts(x, ...)  # S3 method for cum_richness calc_ts(x, ...)  # S3 method for total_occ calc_ts(x, ...)  # S3 method for occ_density calc_ts(x, ...)  # S3 method for newness calc_ts(x, ...)  # S3 method for williams_evenness calc_ts(x, ...)  # S3 method for pielou_evenness calc_ts(x, ...)  # S3 method for ab_rarity calc_ts(x, ...)  # S3 method for area_rarity calc_ts(x, ...)  calc_ts(x)

title: Calculate a Biodiversity Indicator Time Series — calc_ts.obs_richness
text: x object containing necessary data information time series calculation. ... Additional arguments (potentially used specific methods).

title: Calculate a Biodiversity Indicator Time Series — calc_ts.obs_richness
text: object representing calculated biodiversity indicator time series. format output depend specific S3 method used.

what: Calculate Biodiversity Indicators Over Space or Time — compute_indicator_workflow
title: Calculate Biodiversity Indicators Over Space or Time — compute_indicator_workflow
text: function provides flexible framework calculating various biodiversity indicators spatial grid. prepares data, creates grid, calculates indicators, formats output appropriate S3 object ('indicator_map' 'virtual_indicator_map').

title: Calculate Biodiversity Indicators Over Space or Time — compute_indicator_workflow
code: compute_indicator_workflow(   x,   type,   dim_type = c("map", "ts"),   cell_size = NULL,   level = c("continent", "country", "world"),   region = "Europe",   cube_crs = NULL,   ... )

title: Calculate Biodiversity Indicators Over Space or Time — compute_indicator_workflow
text: x data cube object ('processed_cube', 'processed_cube_dsinfo',  'virtual_cube'). type indicator calculate. Supported options include: 'hill0', 'hill1', 'hill2': Hill numbers (order 0, 1, 2). 'obs_richness': Observed species richness. 'total_occ': Total number occurrences. 'newness': Mean year occurrence. 'density': Density occurrences. 'e9_evenness', 'pielou_evenness': Evenness measures. 'ab_rarity', 'area_rarity':  Abundance-based area-based rarity scores. 'spec_occ': Species occurrences. 'tax_distinct': Taxonomic distinctness. cell_size Length grid cell sides, km. (Default: 10 country, 100 continent world) level Spatial level: 'continent', 'country', 'world'. (Default: 'continent') region region interest (e.g., "Europe"). (Default: "Europe") ... Additional arguments passed specific indicator calculation functions.

title: Calculate Biodiversity Indicators Over Space or Time — compute_indicator_workflow
text: S3 object appropriate class containing calculated indicator values metadata: 'indicator_map' real-world observational data calculated grid (map) 'indicator_ts' real-world observational data calculated time (time series) 'virtual_indicator_map' virtual species data calculated grid (map).

title: Calculate Biodiversity Indicators Over Space or Time — compute_indicator_workflow
code: # Assuming 'my_data_cube' is a 'processed_cube' or 'virtual_cube' object diversity_map <- calculate_indicator(my_data_cube, type = "obs_richness", level = "continent", region = "Africa") #> Error in calculate_indicator(my_data_cube, type = "obs_richness", level = "continent",     region = "Africa"): could not find function "calculate_indicator"

what: Extract Years With Observations from an Indicator Map — get_observed_years
title: Extract Years With Observations from an Indicator Map — get_observed_years
text: Takes "indicator_map" object determines years observation data exists.

title: Extract Years With Observations from an Indicator Map — get_observed_years
code: get_observed_years(x)

title: Extract Years With Observations from an Indicator Map — get_observed_years
text: x "indicator_map" object containing calculated indicator values associated grid cells.

title: Extract Years With Observations from an Indicator Map — get_observed_years
text: data frame two columns: years: sequence years covering range observations. occurrences: logical vector indicating observations exist year (TRUE present, FALSE absent).

title: Extract Years With Observations from an Indicator Map — get_observed_years
code: # Assuming you have an 'indicator_map' object named 'my_indicator' observed_data <- get_observed_years(my_indicator) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'my_indicator' not found

title: Extract Species Names. — list_species
text: Retrieves list species names biodiversity data object ('processed_cube', 'indicator_map' 'indicator_ts').

title: Extract Species Names. — list_species
code: list_species(object)

title: Extract Species Names. — list_species
text: object biodiversity data object containing species names, either separate vector called species_names column called scientificName.

title: Extract Species Names. — list_species
text: Either character vector species names (directly available) data frame columns: taxonKey: unique identifier species. scientificName:  scientific name species.

title: Extract Species Names. — list_species
code: # Assuming you have a biodiversity data cube named 'mammals_cube' species_list <- list_species(mammals_cube) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'mammals_cube' not found

title: Pipe operator — %>%
code: lhs %>% rhs

title: Pipe operator — %>%

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: result calling rhs(lhs).

title: Process GBIF Data Cubes — process_cube
text: Processes GBIF data cube associated taxonomic information file. files must reside directory share base file name (e.g., 'my_mammals_cube.csv', 'my_mammals_info.csv').

title: Process GBIF Data Cubes — process_cube
code: process_cube(   cube_name,   tax_info,   datasets_info = NULL,   first_year = NA,   final_year = NA )

title: Process GBIF Data Cubes — process_cube
text: cube_name location name data cube file (e.g., 'data/my_mammals_cube.csv'). tax_info location name associated taxonomic info file (e.g.,  'data/my_mammals_info.csv'). datasets_info location name associated dataset info file (e.g., 'data/my_mammals_datasets.csv'). first_year (Optional) first year occurrences include. specified, uses earliest year present cube. final_year (Optional) final year occurrences include. specified, uses latest year present cube.

title: Process GBIF Data Cubes — process_cube
text: tibble containing processed GBIF occurrence data.

title: Process GBIF Data Cubes — process_cube
code: # Assuming files are located in the 'data' directory: processed_mammals_cube <- process_cube(cube_name = "data/mammals_cube.csv",                                        tax_info = "data/mammals_info.csv") #> Error: 'data/mammals_cube.csv' does not exist in current working directory ('/home/runner/work/b3gbi/b3gbi/docs/reference').
